content: Is there a cargo command for only pulling a crates source? Like vendor but for an arbitrary remote target or install but without the build step?
I usually just use cargo vendor or my own cargo clone command.
But say I don’t have any of the code installed on my machine. Can I still use vendor To pull that source?
vendor will download whatever is needed
Right, but from nothing?
it needs a Cargo.toml right?
maybe I don't understand, like in an empty directory, you want to download "foo"?
also the link you sent seems like what I want
In that case, I would use something like cargo clone log:0.4.11, which will just download the log crate file.
Say I have no rust code at all on my machine
can I vendor an arbitrary crate?
like, I’m in an empty directory and run cargo vendor
cargo vendor needs a manifest, and will download all dependencies. You can create a temporary manifest
Ok, yeah, that answers my question
Thank you!

@Eric Huss Hey, Thanks again for your help and linking me to your repo. I opened a pull request with a few small changes there which I was able to use to unblock my use case in cargo-raze. https://github.com/ehuss/cargo-clone-crate/pull/1
Do you think you'd be able to review my changes? :sweat_smile:
@Eric Huss Wait, I missed your message about cargo clone log:0.4.11 I don't see any reference to a clone command anywhere :(
@Eric Huss Just pinging this thread :sweat_smile:
@UebelAndre I will get to it when I have time. It may be at least a few days.

Yay! Thank you so much :smile:

I was most interested in knowing if you were open to the idea of a PR to your repo. So take your time, but it would help out a lot whenever you get the time :sweat_smile:
